items.title: aspect filter
Finding API example no longer works
items.body:
I tried the example code:
```python
from ebaysdk.finding import Connection as Finding
from ebaysdk.exception import ConnectionError

try:
    api = Finding(config_file='myfile.yaml')
    response = api.execute('findItemsAdvanced', {'keywords': 'Python'})
    print(response.dict())
except ConnectionError as e:
    print(e)
    print(e.response.dict())
```
I got the result:
`ConnectionResetError: [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer`

The current fix is to change to:
```python
api = Finding(config_file='myfile.yaml', https=True)
```

Related eBay blog post [here](https://developer.ebay.com/news/https-only-finding-api/).

items.title: GetSessionID XML body built incorrectly
items.body:
Hi,

I was trying to Fetch Authentication token via the API and using the `dict2xml()` function to validate the xml body passed I got
`<GetSessionIDRequest><RuName>MyRuName</RuName></GetSessionIDRequest>`
The structure passed to `dict2xml` was:

`{'GetSessionIDRequest': [ {'RuName': MyRuName}]}`
OR `{'GetSessionIDRequest': {'RuName': MyRuName }`

However, it seems the body had built in both ways to:

`2019-05-04 17:18:26,103 ebaysdk [DEBUG]:body=b'<?xml version=\'1.0\' encoding=\'utf-8\'?><GetSessionIDRequest xmlns="urn:ebay:apis:eBLBaseComponents"><RequesterCredentials></RequesterCredentials><GetSessionIDRequest><RuName>MyRuName</RuName></GetSessionIDRequest></GetSessionIDRequest>`

Don't know how relevant the error that I receive after this is, but it is `The ru_name in your request is invalid`

Where the correctly built one should have been:
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<GetSessionIDRequest xmlns="urn:ebay:apis:eBLBaseComponents">
<RuName>MyRuName</RuName>
</GetSessionIDRequest>`

Created a "hack" static method  to work around this issue for now. 
    ```@staticmethod
    def dict_response(verb, response, parse_response=True):
        return Response(response,
                       verb=verb,
                       list_nodes=[],
                       datetime_nodes=[],
                       parse_response=parse_response).dict()```

Thanks for the work around the API!

Im using the eBay API and the python ebaysdk module. in my AddFixedPriceItem request to post a new item listing, i want to use Item.ItemCompatibility (In the ebayMotors Category using my Production Keys) but for some reason its just not working. 

According to the online documentation, this is the required xml input:

     `<ItemCompatibilityList> ItemCompatibilityListType
      <Compatibility> ItemCompatibilityType
        <CompatibilityNotes> string </CompatibilityNotes>
        <NameValueList> NameValueListType
          <Name> string </Name>
          <Value> string </Value>
          <!-- ... more Value values allowed here ... -->
        </NameValueList>
        <!-- ... more NameValueList nodes allowed here ... -->
      </Compatibility>
      <!-- ... more Compatibility nodes allowed here ... -->
    </ItemCompatibilityList>`



i have probably 15 or 20 different ways i could think of to rearrange my input to give ebay what they want, but none of them seemed to work. this is the most current bit of code i used in request:

       `api_request = {
            'Item': {
                'Category': category,
                'Title': title,
                'ItemCompatibilityList': {
                    'Compatibility': {
                        {'CompatibilityNotes': 'Fits for all trims and engines.'},
                        {'NameValueList': {'Name':'Year','Value':'2001'}},
                        {'NameValueList': {'Name':'Make','Value':'Honda'}},
                        {'NameValueList': {'Name':'Model','Value':'Accord'}}}}}}

    api = trading(domain=DomainUrl, appid=Id_App, devid=Id_Dev, certid=Id_Cert, config_file=None)
    api.execute('AddFixedPriceItem',api_request)`
            

the listing gets posted and goes active and all other information correctly gets posted, but there is no compatibility in sight. it doesnt show up at all, and i dont get any sort of error telling me what i did wrong.

one compatibility item for eBayMotors is:

    `[Honda, Accord, 2002]`

but what i want is several compatibility items:

and so on. Three or four days ago, I actually got it to work as one single compatibility item at a time. ```
def get_orders(ebay_token, inicio=None, fin=None, cantidad=10, pagina=1):
    api = Trading(config_file=None, appid=EBAY_APP_ID, devid=EBAY_DEV_ID,
                  certid=EBAY_CERT_ID, token=ebay_token, siteid=SITEID)

    params = {
        'CreateTimeFrom': inicio,
        'CreateTimeTo': fin,
        'OrderRole': 'Seller',
        'Pagination': {'EntriesPerPage': cantidad, 'PageNumber': pagina},
    }

    return  api.execute('GetOrders', params)

reponse = get_orders(token, inicio, fin, 2)
orders_ebay = reponse.dict()
```
When we inspect the xml returned from ebay (with response.content) its ok, but with dict call dictionary is: 
```
'OrderArray': {'Order': **[**{'OrderID': ' ...
```
We think that the correct is:
```
'OrderArray': **[**{'Order': {'OrderID': ' ...
```

On transactions happen same behaviour.

We are using python 3.6 on debian. All packages are from pip.

items.title: Classifiers not up to date on pypi?
items.body: On [the pypi page for release 2.1.4](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ebaysdk/) the listed classifiers are "Developers" and "WWW/HTTP", it's missing all the Python version compatibility classifiers depiste those seemingly being in the setup.py, making e.g. caniusepython3 declare that ebaysdk is not P3-compatible.

items.title: Invalid headers Exception with requests >= 2.11
items.body:
Starting from version 2.11 requests library accepts only strings in headers keys/values, so it breaks current implementation in ebay sdk as you are sending some values as int

``` python
/site-packages/requests/utils.py", line 796, in check_header_validity
    if not pat.match(value):
TypeError: expected string or bytes-like object

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 22, in <module>
    'DetailLevel': 'ReturnAll'}
  File "/python3.5/site-packages/ebaysdk/connection.py", line 119, in execute
    self.build_request(verb, data, verb_attrs, files)
  File "/python3.5/site-packages/ebaysdk/connection.py", line 159, in build_request
    self.request = request.prepare()
  File "/python3.5/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 251, in prepare
    hooks=self.hooks,
  File "python3.5/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 295, in prepare
    self.prepare_headers(headers)
  File "/python3.5/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 409, in prepare_headers
    check_header_validity(header)
  File "/python3.5/site-packages/requests/utils.py", line 800, in check_header_validity
    "not %s" % (value, type(value)))
requests.exceptions.InvalidHeader: Header value 3 must be of type str or bytes, not <class 'int'>
```

more information here https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/3512

items.title: Incompatible with requests 2.11+
items.body:
You guys are being too loosey goosy with your header types...  If a project upgrades to requests 2.11 or higher, it will blow up on making an API call.

See reproduction and stacktrace: https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/3512

Details on requests change here: https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/3477

I will make a pull request to fix this, if it will get merged?  I can't tell how active this project is anymore...

```
>>> ebaysdk.utils.dict2xml({'Item': {'WeightMajor': {'#text': 0, '@attrs': {'unit': 'oz'}}}})
'<Item><WeightMajor unit="oz"><#text>0</#text></WeightMajor></Item>'

>>> ebaysdk.utils.dict2xml({'Item': {'WeightMajor': {'#text': 1, '@attrs': {'unit': 'oz'}}}})
'<Item><WeightMajor unit="oz">1</WeightMajor></Item>'
```

I suspect it is because of this section in dict2xml:

```
        if isinstance(root[key], dict):
            attrs, value = attribute_check(root[key])

            if not value:
                value = dict2xml(root[key])
```

That `if not value` should probably something more specific.

items.title: README doesn't mention ebaysdk.finding.Connection requires config file
items.body:
``` python
>>> from ebaysdk.finding import Connection
>>> api = Connection()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/davidmarin/git/spendright/python/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ebaysdk/finding/__init__.py", line 70, in __init__
    config_file=kwargs.get('config_file', 'ebay.yaml'))
  File "/Users/davidmarin/git/spendright/python/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ebaysdk/config.py", line 39, in __init__
    self._populate_yaml_defaults()
  File "/Users/davidmarin/git/spendright/python/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ebaysdk/config.py", line 72, in _populate_yaml_defaults
    raise ConnectionConfigError('config file %s not found' % self.config_file)
ebaysdk.exception.ConnectionConfigError: u'config file ebay.yaml not found'
```

Is this the intended behavior? The README doesn't say anything about needing `ebay.yaml`. Observed this behavior in both 2.0.0 and 2.1.0.

The workaround is to explicitly disable the config file:

``` python
>>> api = Connection(config_file=None)
```

items.title: Python2 UnicodeDecodeError when using non-ascii data along with an unicode auth token
items.body:
Issue occurs on Python2, when setting an eBayAuthToken of unicode type, then send a request with non-ascii characters (in title or description)

``` python
api = Trading(token=unicode(self.user_auth.auth_token))
api.execute('AddItem', {
    "Item": {
        "Title": "é"
    }
})
```

```
  File "ebaysdk/ebaysdk/connection.py", line 118, in execute
    self.build_request(verb, data, verb_attrs)
  File "ebaysdk/ebaysdk/connection.py", line 147, in build_request
    data=self.build_request_data(verb, data, verb_attrs),
  File "ebaysdk/ebaysdk/trading/__init__.py", line 696, in build_request_data
    xml += dict2xml(data)
```

xml is casted to a unicode at line 689:
xml += "<eBayAuthToken>%s</eBayAuthToken>" % self.config.get('token')

then a string containing utf-8 encoded non-ascii data is appended to the unicode xml and fails to be decoded
xml += dict2xml(data)

When I used trading api to list a new item, I was not able to add multiple pictures because the "item" that is passed to the API is a dictionary. And python does not support duplicate keys in a dictionary.

item = {"PictureDetails":
                 "PictureURL": url1
                 "PictureURL": url2
                 ...
           }

items.title: Shopping api: NameValueList doesn't necessarily return a list
items.body:
This tripped up my code. You can make a request:

```
from ebaysdk.shopping import Connection
api = Connection(appid=whatever)
api.execute('GetSingleItem', {'ItemID': 999999999, 'IncludeSelector':'ItemSpecifics'})
```

Then, with the result:

```
api.response_dict()['Item']['ItemSpecifics']['NameValueList']
```

Usually this is a list datatype so its fine, but if there is only one name/value pair it returns a single dictionary `{name:value}` rather than a dictionary as the only element of a list `[{name:value}]`

Easy to accommodate for this, I know, but if the key is called `xyzList` then it should probably always return a `list` datatype. 

This is a really hard to notice bug, since in 99.9999% of all cases, if there are any item specifics, there's more than 1 so it seems like it always returns a list, but sometimes not - which took a while to debug.
